metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3716 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The MSL coder in ImageMagick before 6.9.3-10 and 7.x before 7.0.1-1 allows remote attackers to move arbitrary files via a crafted image. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3716` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1
libgraphicsmagick++3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1
libgraphicsmagick3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.1
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.1
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.1
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.1
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.1
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.1
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1').
imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.1').
